comment: Total (surface + subsurface) runoff (qtot = qs + qsb). Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Water that leaves the surface layer (top soil layer) e.g. as overland flow / fast runoff.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Sum of water that flows out from subsurface layer(s) including the groundwater layer (if present). Equals qg in case of a groundwater layer below only one soil layer.

For models that consider both diffuse and focussed/localised recharge this should be the sum of both; other models should submit the groundwater recharge component that the model simulates. See also the descriptions in qrf and qrd.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Water that directly flows from a surface water body into the groundwater layer below. Only submit if the model separates focussed/localised recharge from diffuse recharge.

Groundwater recharge from water that enters the groundwater layer via percolation through the soil. Only submit if the model separates focussed/localised recharge from diffuse recharge. For models that do not simulate groundwater this can be seepage instead of recharge.
Water that leaves the groundwater layer. In case seepage is simulated but no groundwater layer is present, report seepage as qr and qg.
River discharge or streamflow. Please provide both daily and monthly resolution.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: As evap, but with all resistances set to zero, except the aerodynamic resistance.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Total simulated soil moisture available for evapotranspiration. Please indicate the depth of the root zone for each vegetation type in your model. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Soil Moisture Content at Root Zone

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Please provide soil moisture for all depth levels and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

Temperature of each soil layer. Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea". If daily resolution not possible, please provide monthly. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
Grid cell mean depth of snowpack.
Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen) averaged over grid cell.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Mean monthly water storage in all compartments. Please indicate in the netcdf metadata which storage compartments are considered.
Mean monthly water storage in the canopy.
Mean monthly water storage in glaciers.
Mean monthly water storage in groundwater layer.
Mean monthly water storage in lakes (except reservoirs).
Mean monthly water storage in wetlands.
Mean monthly water storage in rivers.
Mean monthly water storage in reservoirs.
Calculated from daily thaw depths.
Mean monthly water temperature in river (representative of the average temperature across the channel volume).

Irrigation water withdrawn in case of optimal irrigation (i.e. eliminating water stress for the plants). This includes the plant's water requirements over and above precipitation and soil moisture, as well as any losses due to conveyance or irrigation inefficiencies considered.
long_name: Potential Irrigation Water Withdrawal (assuming unlimited water supply)

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Irrigation water withdrawal, taking water availability into account; please provide if computed.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, assuming unlimited water supply.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Soil water demand required to avoid water stress accumulated across the growing season, excluding any water losses associated with application or transport and without constraints due to water availability; only needed for `firr` simulations.
long_name: Cumulative Potential Net Irrigation Water Requirement

comment: Portion of withdrawal that is evapo-transpired, taking water availability into account; if computed.

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed.
long_name: Actual Irrigation Green Water Consumption on Irrigated Cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Potential evapotranspiration from rainwater over irrigated cropland; if computed and different from AIrrUseGreen.
long_name: Potential Irrigation Green Water Consumption on Irrigated Cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Actual evapotranspiration from rainwater over rainfed cropland; if computed.
long_name: Actual Green Water Consumption on Rainfed Cropland

resolution.water_regional: 0.5° grid if possible, otherwise at gauge location

comment: Soil type as used by your model. Please include a description of each type in the model documentation (under "Other data sets used"). Please also include a link to a database/paper describing the parameters and values associated with these soil types.
Yield may be identical to above-ground biomass (biom) if the entire plant is harvested, e.g. for bioenergy production. Yields are reported per growing seasons and not per year.
Evapotranspiration = sum of transpiration, evaporation, interception and sublimation aggregated across the growing season.

Integral of the total nitrogen application rate over the growing season. If organic and inorganic amendments are applied, the nitrogen application should be reported as effective inorganic nitrogen input (ignoring residues).

As Julian dates. The planting date reported here corresponds to the actual planting date in the simulation and may differ from the prescribed crop calendar planting date in rare cases as certain models may delay prescribed planting for a few days to have more suitable soil moisture and temperature conditions.
Together with the day and year of planting it allows for clear identification of anthesis.
Together with the day and year of planting it allows for clear identification of maturity.
Usually the year when maturity is reached. Can also be computed from planting and maturuty day.
The whole plant biomass above ground.
long_name: Total Above Ground Biomass Dry Matter Yields

comment.fire: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
comment.forestry: Species information is essential. Stand total and PFT information is essential.
comment.permafrost: Grid cell total, PFT information if possible.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Above Ground Litter Pool

comment.forestry: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. Species information is essential.
comment.other: Only if models separates below-ground litter and soil carbon. If not, only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass in Below Ground Litter Pool

comment.forestry: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation.
comment.peat: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).
comment.permafrost: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).
comment.other: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and species information is essential.

comment.biomes: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.fire: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.forestry: Soil carbon excluding belowground litter if your model reports clitter. If not including below-ground litter, i.e. only report csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and species information is essential. If possible, provide soil carbon for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide soil carbon integrated over entire soil depth.
comment.peat: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).
comment.permafrost: Soil carbon excluding below-ground litter if your model reports clitterag or clitterbg. If your model does not reports clitterag or clitterbg, report soil carbon including below-ground litter as csoil and document this in the model documentation. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).

long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool in each layer

comment: Products generated during Land-use change. Removed carbon should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation.

comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and Species information is essential.
comment.other: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Gross Primary Production on Land

comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and species information is essential.
comment.other: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and species information is essential.
comment.other: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment.forestry: As kg carbon m⁻² s⁻¹. Stand total and Species information is essential.
comment.other: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment: Total C emitted from all fires (including deforestation and peat fire C emission).
long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to C Emission from Fire

comment.other: Total area percentage of grid cell that has burned at any time (including peat and deforestation fires).

comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes from fire, harvest, grazing and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.
long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Biospheric Production on Land

comment: For wood products only. Sum of carbon fluxes to wood production and wood storage turnover emissions from previous years.
long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Land Use Change

comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Grazing

comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.

comment: If possible, provide carbon fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, only provide “flittersoil-total. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Litter to Soil in each layer

comment: Carbon going  directly into the soil pool without entering litter (e.g., root exudate). Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
long_name: Total Carbon Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

comment: If possible, provide carbon fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, only provide “fvegsoil-total. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

comment: Value between 0 and 100. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
long_name: Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation

comment.forestry: Stand total and species information is essential. If lai is static, the timestep specifier "fixed" can be used.
comment.water_global: If used by, or computed by the model. If lai is static, the timestep specifier "fixed" can be used.
comment.other: Grid cell total and PFT information is essential. If lai is static, the timestep specifier "fixed" can be used.

comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their PFT definitions. This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc. Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid cell that is land. For models that have grid cells partially covered by land and ocean, please document this in the model documentation and provide your land-sea mask along the data uploads.
The canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).
Includes sublimation.
Including sapwood and hardwood.
Including fine and coarse roots.

Positive if upwards. the residual term of the surface energy balance, i.e. the net amount of energy that enters the lake on daily time scale: lakeheatf = swdown - swup + lwdown - lwup - sensheatf - latenheatf (terms defined positive when directed upwards)

Catch at sea of demersal species with L infinity >=30 cm and <90 cm
long_name: Catch Density of Medium Demersals >=30cm and <90cm

comment: Catch at sea of demersal species with L infinity >=90 cm
For ERF models, this occurs when temperature is below threshold (e.g., minimum mortality temperature (MMT)). Report 0 if temperature above threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.
long_name: Number of Deaths Attributable to Cold

comment: Temperature above threshold (ERFs). Report 0 if temperature below threshold. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.
long_name: Number of Deaths Attributable to Heat

comment: To be reported as annual series of mean daily total mortality, or as a single number of mean daily mortality; to be used for computations of attributable fractions. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.
Baseline population data should be provided for computations of mortality rates (i.e. deaths per total population). See Section ‎5.1.6. Can have gender, age, etc. dimensions; see below.
Area percentage of grid cell that has burned from deforestation fires (if simulated). Should be part of burntarea-total.
long_name: Burnt Area Fraction from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change

comment: Area percentage of grid cell that has burned from peatland fires (if simulated). Should be part of burntarea-total.
long_name: Burnt Area Fraction from Peat Fire

comment: C emitted from peat fires (if simulated). Should also be part of ffire.
C emitted from deforestation fires (if simulated). Should be part of ffire.
long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Fire Mediated Land-Cover Change

comment: If calculated, weighted by burned area. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.
(between 0 and 1), fraction of fuel combusted in a fire. Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.
long_name: Combustion Completeness of Different Fuel Classes

comment: As a fraction of fuel dry mass (not percentage). Model-specific fuel classes stored in the `classes` attribute of the `fuelclass` dimension.
long_name: Fuel Moisture for Different Fuel Classes

comment: 95th percentile of number of fires in one day during the month
Fraction of area covered by trees
Monthly mean weighted with the number of fires of each day
95th percentile of fire size computed during the month
Mean needs to be weighted with the number of fires
Mean needs to be weighted with burned area
long_name: Weighted Mean Fire Rate of Spread

comment: Mean height of canopy formed by trees over 5m.  Vegetation of less than 5m should be excluded from the canopy height calculation (i.e. not contributing with zero)
Fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation less than 5 m tall
Fraction of grid cell covered with vegetation more than 5 m tall
The total area associated with each grid cell in the model.

The fraction of each grid cell that is assumed to be continent, i.e., not ocean. Should be 0 if the entire cell is assumed to be ocean, 1 if the entire cell is assumed to be covered by land or inland water bodies.

Net upward flux of methane from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).
long_name: Grid averaged methane emissions from wetland

comment: If possible, provide CH₄ emissions for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Total Surface Carbon Mass Flux into CH4 emissions

comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.
frequency: monthly, else annual (or fixed if static)

comment: If possible, provide soil respiration for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. If you do not report layers, the depth dimension is 1. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>. If your model simulates soil organic carbon pools of different turnover times, the variable can additionally be provided separated by pools (see note below the table).
long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Soil Respiration on Land of pools with different turnover time in each layer

comment: Grid cell total.
long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Soil Respiration on Land

comment: If possible, provide net changes due to vertical fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Vertical Carbon Mass Flux between layers

comment: If possible, provide net changes due to vertical fluxes for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Litter Respiration on Land in each layer

comment: Grid cell total.
Grid cell total.
long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Above Ground Vegetation Biomass

comment: Grid cell total.
long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Below Ground Vegetation Biomass

comment: Can be split into nMineralNH4, mineral ammonium in the soil and nMineralNO3 mineral nitrate in the soil. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

Products generated during Land-use change. Removed nitrogen should not go into the soil but into the product pool. Please use the product classes used within your model and document them in the model documentation .
long_name: Nitrogen in Products of Land Use Change

comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire.
long_name: Total Nitrogen lost to the atmosphere (including NHx, N2O, N2) from fire

comment: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.
long_name: Total nitrogen lost to the atmosphere (sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)

comment: Leaching means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil.
long_name: Total nitrogen loss due to leaching or runoff (sum of ammonium, nitrite and nitrate)

comment: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area.
long_name: Total nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure)
Total nitrogen lost (including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and leaching)
Nitrogen in deforested or harvested biomass as a result of anthropogenic land-use or change
Nitrogen mass flux out of land due to any human activity
Total nitrogen mass flux from vegetation to litter
Total nitrogen mass flux from vegetation directly to soil
Total nitrogen mass flux from litter to soil

comment: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.
Surface upward flux of ammonia (NH3) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.
Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.
Surface deposition rate of nitrogen.
long_name: Dry and wet deposition of reactive nitrogen onto land

comment: If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Net nitrogen release from soil and litter as the outcome of nitrogen immobilisation and gross mineralisation

comment: If possible, provide heterotrophic respiration for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide heterotrophic respiration integrated over the entire soil depth. See instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land in each layer

comment: Refers to secondary bioenergy crops and should not be included in fcropharvest-total. Grid cell total and PFT information is essential.
long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere from Bioenergy Harvesting

comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by the natural, drained, restored or mineral (i.e. not peat) peat types. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). Report only one year if fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

Thickness of peat layer. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). Report only one year if fixed depth is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

Hydraulic conductivity at saturation. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

Volumetric fraction of pore space in soil. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.

Water table level relative to the ground surface. Note that a negative value should depict a water table below the soil surface. If the model works with subgrid topographic variation (microtopography approach in peatlands), the reference soil surface for **wt** is represented by the mean elevation of the soil surface. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).

Volumetric soil moisture. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -5 hPa

comment: Volumetric soil moisture. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -15 hPa

comment: Volumetric soil moisture. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -50 hPa

comment: Volumetric soil moisture. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -330 hPa

comment: Volumetric soil moisture. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
long_name: Volumetric soil moisture contents at -15000 hPa

comment: Grid fraction that is flooded, i.e. where the water table is above ground surface. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).
Depth of drainage of artificial drainage network. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).
Density of drainage network as total length of drainage network per km². Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table).

Age of soil carbon. Should be reported separately for each peat soil type (see note below the table). If possible, provide for all depth layers (i.e. 3D-field), and indicate depth in m. Otherwise, provide integrated over the entire soil depth. If depth varies over time or space, see instructions for depth layers on <https://www.isimip.org/protocol/preparing-simulation-files>.
